page.title: 11VICTORIAN CLASSROOM,LEEDS
page.content: The classroom, situated in a converted mill,is equipped with old furnishings from local schools. For our morning's visit, we exchanged maroon school uniform for plain, dark clothes, protected by white smocks. Boys wore{Victorian-style clothes}too. We looked like Victorian pupils with our long hair neatly plaited. The day began with an{assembly.}A boy collected the pennies which Victorian pupils would have paid. Our{lessons} were those that were taught in those days. We each had an old name to use for the day. We wrote on slates and with pen and ink. We did exercises with dumb bells, not like our P.E. The {teacher}seemed much stricter; she had a cane which she threatened to use. It was interesting to be a Victorian pupil for the morning but we prefer 1985. { Claire and Miranda,age 11 yrs
